name: sfchronicle
text: PG&E officials said Saturday that the utility is not planning to initiate a Public Safety Power Shutoff related to the upcoming weather system ‚Äî which prompted a red flag warning ‚Äî ‚Äúbecause the conditions do not meet our rigorous thresholds for doing so.‚Äù https://t.co/v0WooUxtXs

name: sfchronicle
text:
What's causing the Bay Area's fire-starting lightning storms? They're the product of tropical moisture heading into the region. 

A forecast of more possible storms this weekend is linked to the remnants of Hurricane Genevieve in the Baja Peninsula. 

https://t.co/qqQ2Re18xa

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many things have to go right in a long winning streak, and the A‚Äôs run of nine consecutive wins at home ended Saturday due in part to an unusual flaw for them: defense.

https://t.co/CnsuKOyTOR

name: sfchronicle
text:
Cal Fire shares phone numbers for residents to call to get information on local complex fires:

- CZU: 831-335-6717 (211 for San Mateo County) 
- LNU:  707-967-4207 
- SCU: 916-618-3195 or 669-247-7431
- Butte/Tehama:  530-538-7826

name: sfchronicle
text: Among the casualties of the #LNULightningComplex fires are many of the farms in Vacaville‚Äôs Pleasants Valley, a unique agricultural community with lots of small-scale, family-owned businesses. https://t.co/U8eimq0aaN

name: sfchronicle
text: The arrival of destructive wildfires is aligning with the beginning of harvest, and that presents a much larger threat to the wine industry: Could 2020‚Äôs grapes burn on the vine before anyone can pick them? https://t.co/CLQiiTBrQI

name: sfchronicle
text: By now, California winemakers are accustomed to dealing with fire season in conjunction with harvest season, their busiest and most critical time of year. But 2020 is different. https://t.co/1gQsCMbfat

name: sfchronicle
text:
These state parks and forests in Santa Cruz County will be closed starting Sunday due to fire danger:

- Soquel Demonstration State Forest
- Portions of The Forest of Nisene Marks State Park

https://t.co/khZVCSZyND

name: sfchronicle
text:
New evacuation orders issued for the Carmel and River fires: 

- All areas east of Carmel Valley Road, south from Finch Creek to Arroyo Seco Road 
- All areas west of River Road/Fort Romie Road/Arroyo Seco Road extending south to Elm Ave/Arroyo Seco Road

https://t.co/Pry86x5AjV

name: sfchronicle
text:
Cal Fire announces more evacuation warnings in Alameda County including:

- South of the Livermore City limits
- East of Curtner Rd south along I-680 to the Santa Clara County line
- South of Highway 84 in-between Vineyard Avenue and I-680

Full list: https://t.co/ZV0pex9udz

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest on the #CZULightningComplex fires, from Cal Fire:

- 67,000 acres
- 5% contained
- 115 structures destroyed
- 24,300 structures threatened
- 1,349 firefighters battling the blaze 

Follow live updates here: https://t.co/3VPnCJIFme

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest numbers on the biggest Northern California wildfires: 

#SCULightningComplex: 339,968 acres burned, 10% contained

#LNULightningComplex: 325,128 acres burned, 15% contained

See the scope of the blazes on our Fire Tracker: https://t.co/JrvvvptEIT https://t.co/Kbhp5xVlBc

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: The Marin County Fire Department said firefighters are responding to a "series of fires in the area above" Indian Valley College in Novato. Officials are asking people to avoid the area. No evacuations have been issued at this time. https://t.co/WO7dt7tvVr

name: sfchronicle
text:
Our Air Quality Map shows in real time:
- Locations of #LNULightningComplex, #CZULightningComplex, Bay Area fires
- Wind direction/speeds
- Air quality data from local sensors
- Smoke forecast
So you can assess how fires are affecting conditions near you. https://t.co/ebGMSbiTrO https://t.co/Bm1wuANZjO

name: sfchronicle
text: Marin County sheriff‚Äôs officials said Novato police are searching for a person who is ‚Äúconsidered armed and dangerous in the area of the series of fires‚Äù that firefighters are battling near the College of Marin Indian Valley Campus. https://t.co/oc4ZYRvtEU

name: sfchronicle
text:
President Trump will use California as a foil during the #RNCConvention this week, holding up the Democratic-run state and its cities as a model of the socialist takeover he says Joe Biden would bring to the nation.

@joegarofoli has a preview >> https://t.co/zfAB7XZMcC

name: sfchronicle
text: Cal Fire announced evacuation orders for another area of Alameda County early Sunday, adding the area south of Welch Creek Road to the fire perimeter and the Alameda-Santa Clara County line east of Calaveras Road at Welch Creek Road to the fire perimeter. https://t.co/Wp32rnBJnk https://t.co/R4x5K1MsiR

name: sfchronicle
text: Thunderstorms, high winds could make wildfire fight even harder Sunday. The National Weather Service issued a red-flag fire warning starting at 5 a.m. Sunday through 5 p.m. Monday. https://t.co/40Kjx4Fujn https://t.co/rh7xxgC2wY

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/N2f7qff1Tf

name: sfchronicle
text:
Abused by their husbands, then held by the system, these women are getting a new life after being given life without parole.

@philmatier has the story >> https://t.co/Bei3wBax0m

name: sfchronicle
text:
In the past week, the extent and complexity of raging wildfires have stretched California‚Äôs firefighting resources to the limit. 

And it‚Äôs only August. The most dangerous fire-prone months are still to come.

https://t.co/b8SyhCKhKn

name: sfchronicle
text: Cal Fire officials said the CZU Lightning Complex fires burned 71,000 acres and were 8% contained Sunday morning. Officials at a news conference also said 129 structures have been destroyed in San Mateo and Santa Cruz counties. https://t.co/dQQDrxuAnA https://t.co/gqUkA1jh4n

name: sfchronicle
text: The Woodward Fire remains at 2,689 acres and 5% containment thanks to continued support from aircraft including large air tankers. Point Reyes National Seashore remains closed, including the Point Reyes Lighthouse. https://t.co/39hNYQoWnJ https://t.co/azODBEBJAw

name: sfchronicle
text: Cal Fire officials expect the LNU Lightning Complex to continue to grow, with the blazes making runs in multiple directions and thunderstorms in the forecast. The complex is 17% contained, with 30,500 structures threatened, 845 destroyed and 231 damaged.  https://t.co/j0IHATqVR5 https://t.co/cyKosADKDv

name: sfchronicle
text: The fire near Carmel Valley consumed about 1,000 more acres by Sunday morning, though fire crews made some progress, going from 5% to 10% containment. The flames threaten 13,261 structures and have destroyed 47. https://t.co/npR8F0sBvW https://t.co/nZlfxsdKLo

name: sfchronicle
text: The southern portion of the River Fire, which has burned 48,424 acres south of Salinas, continued to rage overnight. Anticipated winds on Sunday could push the flames farther south, potentially merging into the Carmel Fire in Carmel Valley. https://t.co/0UIAPNQpsQ https://t.co/rxh0uI8t3e

name: sfchronicle
text: The SCU Lightning Complex tested containment lines Saturday night into Sunday morning with warm temperatures and southwest winds, but fire crews were able to keep the complex at 339,968 acres and 10% containment. https://t.co/QLlZwcFOjc https://t.co/iQTGUH08JJ

name: sfchronicle
text: The Giants have designated Hunter Pence for assignment, cutting ties with the outfielder who was a key figure and inspiration on two World Series championship teams. https://t.co/I7UhquWokA https://t.co/kYiPoF1wGA
